Parameters.Name: ADVANCED_SECURITY-3-1-6 Get Assigned Server Certificate - CA

Test.Name: There is no Advanced Security service
There is no Keystore Client service address
There is no TLSServer Client service address
Correct response - empty AssignedServerCertificates initial list
Incorrect certificate ID in the initial list

ExpectedResult.TestSummary:
ADVANCED_SECURITY-3-1-6 Get Assigned Server Certificate - CA
STEP 1 - Check crypto library is available STEP PASSED
STEP 2 - Get Advanced Security service address Transmit done Receive done http://localhost:17934/ServiceAdvancedSecurity10/AdvancedSecurityService.asmx STEP PASSED
STEP 3 - Check that the DUT returned Advanced Security service address STEP PASSED
STEP 4 - Get Keystore Client service address Transmit done Receive done http://localhost:17934/ServiceAdvancedSecurity10/AdvancedSecurityService.asmx STEP PASSED
STEP 5 - Check that the DUT returned Keystore Client service address STEP PASSED
STEP 6 - Get TLSServer Client service address Transmit done Receive done http://localhost:17934/ServiceAdvancedSecurity10/AdvancedSecurityService.asmx STEP PASSED
STEP 7 - Check that the DUT returned TLSServer Client service address STEP PASSED
STEP 8 - Check that Advance Security Service is accessible STEP PASSED
STEP 9 - Get Assigned Server Certificates Transmit done Receive done The 'http://www.onvif.org/ver10/advancedsecurity/wsdl:CertificationPathID' element is invalid - The value '!!!InPathID1' is invalid according to its datatype 'http://www.onvif.org/ver10/advancedsecurity/wsdl:CertificationPathID' - The '!' character, hexadecimal value 0x21, cannot be included in a name. STEP FAILED
TEST FAILED
